newsitem.title: USA: Janus fund manager had sought to buy firm - Journal.
newsitem.headline: Janus fund manager had sought to buy firm - Journal.

text.p: Janus Capital Corp fund manager Tom Marsico's resignation earlier this week came after he had discussions with his boss about buying the mutual fund company, the Wall Street Journal reported Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Marsico, 42, approached Janus chief executive and founder Thomas Bailey late last year about combining with him to buy Janus, which is 83 percent owned by Kansas City Southern Industries, the newspaper said.
But Bailey, who owns 12 percent of Janus, rebuffed Marsico's bid, the paper said. Tensions then escalated between the two, the sources told the paper.
Janus, if it were sold, could fetch between $1 billion and $2 billion, the Journal said.
